section.title: Interrupt Collector Interface (InterruptCollectorIfc)
section.para: Interface containing a basic Interrupt Collector block.

entry.para: Resets of Registers of Interrupt Collector Interface

section.title: Interrupt Collector Block (InterruptCollectorBlk)
section.para: This block defines a basic interrupt collector for level triggered interrupt sources. Usually edge triggered sources e.g., timer pulses can be converted to level triggered ones by catching them in the user logic.

listitem.para: Allow interrupt processing by multiple CPUs without need for spinlocks.
Enable forwarding an interrupt to the CPU(s) by a mask for each source.
Provide control pulses to notify the user logic when a interrupt service for an interrupt request has been started and has been ended.
Use the control pulses to reset the interrupt request fo a source or do it by a write or read access directly to the user logic e.g. reading the receive data register of an UART.

table.title: Registers or Delegates of Interrupt Collector Block

entry.para: Registers or Delegates of Interrupt Collector Block
Interrupt is not forwarded to CPU(s).
Interrupt is not forwarded to CPU(s).
Interrupt is not forwarded to CPU(s).
Interrupt is not forwarded to CPU(s).
Writing this value has no effect.
Notifies HW that a pending interrupt has been recognized by SW.
SW confirms that a respective interrupt service routine has been entered. The value isn’t stored, thus there is no need to reset it to ‘0’ again. Solely the write action is sufficient.
The bit Request is set to NotPending after reset in the usually attached InterruptCollector HW block.

Writing this value has no effect.
Notifies HW that a pending interrupt has been recognized by SW.
SW confirms that a respective interrupt service routine has been processed completely. The value isn’t stored, thus there is no need to reset it to ‘0’ again. Solely the write action is sufficient.
The bit Service is set to Ended after reset in the usually attached InterruptCollector HW block.
